alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 3:48PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding possible along Rock Creek south of Toms Place caused by excessive upstream rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of east central California, including the following county, Southwest Mono. * WHEN...Until 545 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows will be elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 344 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain recently fell due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen upstream in the Rock Creek basin. - Rock Creek is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... French Camp Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
